_description: This file demonstrates all available configuration options for the ASCII Calendar application
_events_file_path_description: Path to the JSON file where events are stored. Can be absolute or relative path. Supports ~ for home directory.
_week_start_day_description: First day of the week in calendar display. 0 = Sunday first, 1 = Monday first

ui_theme._theme_description: Complete color theme configuration for all UI elements. Colors can be specified as color names with optional attributes.
ui_theme._color_syntax: Colors: black, red, green, yellow, blue, magenta, cyan, white, bright_* variants, default
ui_theme._color_attributes: Attributes: bold, underline, reverse (combine with | e.g., 'red|bold')
ui_theme._day_header_description: Colors for day-of-week headers (e.g., 'Su Mo Tu We Th Fr Sa')
ui_theme._regular_day_description: Colors for regular calendar day numbers
ui_theme._selected_today_description: Colors when selected date is also today
ui_theme._event_day_description: Colors for days that have events
ui_theme._event_header_description: Colors for event list section headers
ui_theme._event_text_description: Colors for event list item text
ui_theme._selected_event_description: Colors for selected event in event lists
ui_theme._more_events_description: Colors for '... and X more events' indicators
ui_theme._input_description: Colors for input prompts and fields
ui_theme._instructions_description: Colors for key legends and instruction text

_predefined_themes._description: The application includes three predefined themes that can be loaded programmatically
_predefined_themes.default: Standard theme with moderate colors suitable for most terminals
_predefined_themes.dark: High-contrast theme optimized for dark terminal backgrounds
_predefined_themes.light: Theme optimized for light terminal backgrounds with darker text

_usage_notes: Remove all lines starting with '_' - they are comments for this example
The configuration file is automatically created at ~/.ascii-calendar/configuration.json
If configuration file doesn't exist, defaults are used
Colors automatically fall back to monochrome attributes on unsupported terminals
Invalid colors fall back to defaults with error logging
